core_claim: The actors who played the original Darth Vader (David Prowse) and Chewbacca (Peter Mayhew) in Star Wars lived next door to each other for over a decade in London, completely by coincidence.
source_citation: BBC News, 'Star Wars neighbours: Darth Vader and Chewbacca lived next door', 2015; Confirmed in Peter Mayhew's autobiography 'My Favorite Giant'
why_strange: Two iconic opposing characters from a galaxy far, far away coincidentally became real-life neighbors on Earth.

core_claim: Mark Twain was born and died during appearances of Halley's Comet, accurately predicting his own death would coincide with the comet's return.

supporting_details.prediction_quote: I came in with Halley's Comet in 1835. It is coming again next year, and I expect to go out with it.

source_citation: The Autobiography of Mark Twain, University of California Press; NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory Halley's Comet historical records
why_strange: A famous author's life was perfectly bookended by a celestial event that occurs only once every 76 years.

core_claim: Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company while the Eiffel Tower was being completed, and Jack the Ripper was still active in London.
source_citation: Nintendo Company History Archives; The Eiffel Tower Official Records; The Complete History of Jack the Ripper by Philip Sugden, 1994
why_strange: A modern video game giant began during the Victorian era, contemporaneous with iconic 19th century events.

core_claim: When Fidel Castro visited New York in 1959, his security detail was provided by the Hells Angels motorcycle club, arranged by a Hells Angels leader who admired the Cuban Revolution.

supporting_details.location: New York City, Statler Hilton Hotel

source_citation: Hells Angels: A Strange and Terrible Saga by Hunter S. Thompson, 1966; The New York Times archives, April 1959; Cuban State Archives
why_strange: An infamous outlaw motorcycle gang provided security for a communist revolutionary leader in the heart of capitalist America.

core_claim: John Adams and Thomas Jefferson, both Founding Fathers and U.S. Presidents, died on the exact same day—July 4, 1826—the 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence.

supporting_details.location: Adams in Quincy, Massachusetts; Jefferson at Monticello, Virginia
supporting_details.participants: John Adams (2nd U.S. President), Thomas Jefferson (3rd U.S. President)
supporting_details.event: 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence

why_strange: Two political rivals and co-authors of the Declaration died hours apart on its 50th anniversary

core_claim: The first person killed by a robot was Robert Williams in 1979, and the first person killed by a self-driving car was Elaine Herzberg in 2018—both occurred in the same U.S. state: Michigan.

supporting_details.location: Flat Rock, Michigan (Williams); Tempe, Arizona (Herzberg, but Uber was based in Michigan)
supporting_details.participants: Robert Williams (Ford Motor Company employee), Elaine Herzberg (pedestrian)
supporting_details.technology: Industrial robot arm (1979); Uber autonomous vehicle (2018)

source_citation: The New York Times, July 9, 1981; NTSB Report on Uber Crash, 2019
why_strange: Both historic robot-related deaths are linked to Michigan, the heart of the U.S. auto industry

core_claim: Abraham Lincoln and Charles Darwin were born on the exact same day: February 12, 1809.

supporting_details.location: Lincoln: Hardin County, Kentucky, USA; Darwin: Shrewsbury, Shropshire, England
supporting_details.participants: Abraham Lincoln (16th U.S. President), Charles Darwin (naturalist, author of 'On the Origin of Species')

source_citation: National Park Service; Darwin Correspondence Project, University of Cambridge
why_strange: Two of the most influential figures in politics and science were born on the same day, worlds apart
